an10.211:1.1.pli: “Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an10.211:1.1.eng: “Someone with ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.211:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti, luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho adayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtesu.
an10.211:1.3.eng: It’s when a certain person kills living creatures. They’re violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.

an10.211:2.1.pli: Adinnādāyī hoti, yaṃ taṃ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṃ gāmagataṃ vā araññagataṃ vā, taṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādātā hoti.
an10.211:2.1.eng: They steal. With the intention to commit theft, they take the wealth or belongings of others from village or wilderness.

an10.211:3.1.pli: Kāmesu micchācārī hoti, yā tā māturakkhitā piturakkhitā mātāpiturakkhitā bhāturakkhitā bhaginirakkhitā ñātirakkhitā gottarakkhitā dhammarakkhitā sasāmikā saparidaṇḍā antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittāpi, tathārūpāsu cārittaṃ āpajjitā hoti.
an10.211:3.1.eng: They commit sexual misconduct. They have sexual relations with women who have their mother, father, both mother and father, brother, sister, relatives, or clan as guardian. They have sexual relations with a woman who is protected on principle, or who has a husband, or whose violation is punishable by law, or even one who has been garlanded as a token of betrothal.

an10.211:4.1.pli: Musāvādī hoti, sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho: ‘ehambho purisa, yaṃ jānāsi taṃ vadehī’ti, so ajānaṃ vā āha: ‘jānāmī’ti, jānaṃ vā āha: ‘na jānāmī’ti, apassaṃ vā āha: ‘passāmī’ti, passaṃ vā āha: ‘na passāmī’ti. Iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:4.1.eng: They lie. They’re summoned to a council, an assembly, a family meeting, a guild, or to the royal court, and asked to bear witness: ‘Please, worthy man, say what you know.’ Not knowing, they say ‘I know.’ Knowing, they say ‘I don’t know.’ Not seeing, they say ‘I see.’ And seeing, they say ‘I don’t see.’ So they deliberately lie for the sake of themselves or another, or for some trivial worldly reason.

an10.211:5.1.pli: Pisuṇavāco hoti, ito sutvā amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya. Iti samaggānaṃ vā bhettā bhinnānaṃ vā anuppadātā vaggārāmo vaggarato vagganandī, vaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:5.1.eng: They speak divisively. They repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other. And so they divide those who are harmonious, supporting division, delighting in division, loving division, speaking words that promote division.

an10.211:6.1.pli: Pharusavāco hoti, yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā parakaṭukā parābhisajjanī kodhasāmantā asamādhisaṃvattanikā, tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:6.1.eng: They speak harshly. They use the kinds of words that are cruel, nasty, hurtful, offensive, bordering on anger, not leading to immersion.

an10.211:7.1.pli: Samphappalāpī hoti, akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī, anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.
an10.211:7.1.eng: They talk nonsense. Their speech is untimely, and is neither factual nor beneficial. It has nothing to do with the teaching or the training. Their words have no value, and are untimely, unreasonable, rambling, and pointless.

an10.211:8.1.pli: Abhijjhālu hoti, yaṃ taṃ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ abhijjhātā hoti: ‘aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mama assā’ti.
an10.211:8.1.eng: They’re covetous. They covet the wealth and belongings of others: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’

an10.211:9.1.pli: Byāpannacitto hoti, paduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā haññantu vā bajjhantu vā ucchijjantu vā vinassantu vā mā vā ahesun’ti.
an10.211:9.1.eng: They have ill will and malicious intentions: ‘May these sentient beings be killed, slaughtered, slain, destroyed, or annihilated!’

an10.211:10.1.eng: They have wrong view. Their perspective is distorted:

an10.211:11.1.pli: ‘natthi dinnaṃ, natthi yiṭṭhaṃ, natthi hutaṃ, natthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, natthi ayaṃ loko, natthi paro loko, natthi mātā, natthi pitā, natthi sattā opapātikā, natthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
an10.211:11.1.eng: ‘There’s no meaning in giving, sacrifice, or offerings. There’s no fruit or result of good and bad deeds. There’s no afterlife. There’s no such thing as mother and father, or beings that are reborn spontaneously. And there’s no ascetic or brahmin who is rightly comported and rightly practiced, and who describes the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’

an10.211:11.2.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an10.211:11.2.eng: Someone with these ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.211:12.1.pli: Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an10.211:12.1.eng: Someone with ten qualities is raised up to heaven.

an10.211:12.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
an10.211:12.3.eng: It’s when a certain person gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of sympathy for all living beings.

an10.211:13.1.pli: Adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti. Yaṃ taṃ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṃ gāmagataṃ vā araññagataṃ vā, na taṃ adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādātā hoti.
an10.211:13.1.eng: They give up stealing. They don’t, with the intention to commit theft, take the wealth or belongings of others from village or wilderness.

an10.211:14.1.pli: Kāmesumicchācāraṃ pahāya kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti. Yā tā māturakkhitā …pe… antamaso mālāguḷaparikkhittāpi, tathārūpāsu na cārittaṃ āpajjitā hoti.
an10.211:14.1.eng: They give up sexual misconduct. They don’t have sex with women who have their mother, father, both mother and father, brother, sister, relatives, or clan as guardian. They don’t have sex with a woman who is protected on principle, or who has a husband, or whose violation is punishable by law, or even one who has been garlanded as a token of betrothal.

an10.211:15.1.pli: Musāvādaṃ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato hoti. Sabhaggato vā parisaggato vā ñātimajjhagato vā pūgamajjhagato vā rājakulamajjhagato vā abhinīto sakkhipuṭṭho: ‘ehambho purisa, yaṃ jānāsi taṃ vadehī’ti, so ajānaṃ vā āha: ‘na jānāmī’ti, jānaṃ vā āha: ‘jānāmī’ti, apassaṃ vā āha: ‘na passāmī’ti, passaṃ vā āha: ‘passāmī’ti. Iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā na sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:15.1.eng: They give up lying. They’re summoned to a council, an assembly, a family meeting, a guild, or to the royal court, and asked to bear witness: ‘Please, worthy man, say what you know.’ Not knowing, they say ‘I don’t know.’ Knowing, they say ‘I know.’ Not seeing, they say ‘I don’t see.’ And seeing, they say ‘I see.’ So they don’t deliberately lie for the sake of themselves or another, or for some trivial worldly reason.

an10.211:16.1.pli: Pisuṇavācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti—na ito sutvā amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya. Iti bhinnānaṃ vā sandhātā sahitānaṃ vā anuppadātā samaggārāmo samaggarato samagganandī, samaggakaraṇiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:16.1.eng: They give up divisive speech. They don’t repeat in one place what they heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, they reconcile those who are divided and support those who are united, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.

an10.211:17.1.pli: Pharusavācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti. Yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā, tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti.
an10.211:17.1.eng: They give up harsh speech. They speak in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.

an10.211:18.1.pli: Samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī, atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ.
an10.211:18.1.eng: They give up talking nonsense. Their words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training. They say things at the right time which are valuable, reasonable, succinct, and beneficial.

an10.211:19.1.pli: Anabhijjhālu hoti. Yaṃ taṃ parassa paravittūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhātā hoti: ‘aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mama assā’ti.
an10.211:19.1.eng: They’re content. They don’t covet the wealth and belongings of others: ‘Oh, if only their belongings were mine!’

an10.211:20.1.pli: Abyāpannacitto hoti appaduṭṭhamanasaṅkappo: ‘ime sattā averā hontu abyāpajjā anīghā, sukhī attānaṃ pariharantū’ti.
an10.211:20.1.eng: They have a kind heart and loving intentions: ‘May these sentient beings live free of enmity and ill will, untroubled and happy!’

an10.211:21.1.eng: They have right view, an undistorted perspective:

an10.211:21.2.pli: ‘atthi dinnaṃ, atthi yiṭṭhaṃ, atthi hutaṃ, atthi sukaṭadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, atthi ayaṃ loko, atthi paro loko, atthi mātā, atthi pitā, atthi sattā opapātikā, atthi loke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sammaggatā sammāpaṭipannā ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.
an10.211:21.2.eng: ‘There is meaning in giving, sacrifice, and offerings. There are fruits and results of good and bad deeds. There is an afterlife. There are such things as mother and father, and beings that are reborn spontaneously. And there are ascetics and brahmins who are rightly comported and rightly practiced, and who describe the afterlife after realizing it with their own insight.’

an10.211:22.1.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an10.211:22.1.eng: Someone with these ten qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an10.213:1.1.pli: “Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an10.213:1.1.eng: “A lady with ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.213:1.13.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an10.213:1.13.eng: A lady with these ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.213:2.1.pli: Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.

an10.213:2.9.eng: She doesn’t indulge in talking nonsense. …

an10.213:2.13.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an10.213:2.13.eng: A lady with these ten qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an10.214:1.1.pli: “Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ niraye.
an10.214:1.1.eng: “A laywoman with ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.214:1.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ niraye.
an10.214:1.5.eng: A laywoman with these ten qualities is cast down to hell.

an10.214:2.1.pli: Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ sagge.
an10.214:2.1.eng: A laywoman with ten qualities is raised up to heaven.

an10.214:2.5.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ sagge”.
an10.214:2.5.eng: A laywoman with these ten qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an10.215:1.1.pli: “Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā avisāradā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an10.215:1.1.eng: “A laywoman living at home with these ten qualities is not self-assured.

an10.215:1.13.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā avisāradā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an10.215:1.13.eng: A laywoman living at home with these ten qualities is not self-assured.

an10.215:2.1.pli: Dasahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā visāradā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati.
an10.215:2.1.eng: A laywoman living at home with these ten qualities is self-assured.

an10.215:2.13.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, dasahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā visāradā agāraṃ ajjhāvasatī”ti.
an10.215:2.13.eng: A laywoman living at home with these ten qualities is self-assured.”

an10.216:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you an exposition of the teaching on creepy creatures.

an10.216:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an10.216:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an10.216:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an10.216:2.1.eng: “What is the exposition of the teaching on creepy creatures?

an10.216:2.2.pli: Kammassakā, bhikkhave, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammapaṭisaraṇā, yaṃ kammaṃ karonti—
an10.216:2.2.eng: Sentient beings are the owners of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.

an10.216:2.3.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavanti.
an10.216:2.3.eng: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.

an10.216:3.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho, adayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtesu.
an10.216:3.1.eng: Take a certain someone who kills living creatures. They’re violent, bloody-handed, a hardened killer, merciless to living beings.

an10.216:3.2.pli: So saṃsappati kāyena, saṃsappati vācāya, saṃsappati manasā.
an10.216:3.2.eng: They’re creepy in body, speech, and mind.

an10.216:3.3.pli: Tassa jimhaṃ kāyakammaṃ hoti, jimhaṃ vacīkammaṃ, jimhaṃ manokammaṃ, jimhā gati, jimhupapatti.
an10.216:3.3.eng: Doing crooked deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth are crooked.

an10.216:4.1.pli: Jimhagatikassa kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, jimhupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
an10.216:4.1.eng: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is crooked is reborn in one of two places, I say:

an10.216:4.2.pli: ye vā ekantadukkhā nirayā yā vā saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni.
an10.216:4.2.eng: in an exclusively painful hell, or among the species of creepy animals.

an10.216:4.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni?
an10.216:4.3.eng: And what are the species of creepy animals?

an10.216:4.4.pli: Ahi vicchikā satapadī nakulā biḷārā mūsikā ulūkā, ye vā panaññepi keci tiracchānayonikā sattā manusse disvā saṃsappanti.
an10.216:4.4.eng: Snakes, scorpions, centipedes, mongooses, cats, mice, owls, or whatever other species of animal that creep away when they see humans.

an10.216:4.5.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti.
an10.216:4.5.eng: This is how a being is born from a being.

an10.216:4.6.eng: For your deeds determine your rebirth,

an10.216:4.7.eng: and when you’re reborn contacts strike you.

an10.216:4.8.eng: This is why I say that sentient beings are heirs to their deeds.

an10.216:5.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco adinnādāyī hoti …pe…

an10.216:5.12.pli: So saṃsappati kāyena, saṃsappati vācāya, saṃsappati manasā.
an10.216:5.12.eng: They’re creepy in body, speech, and mind.

an10.216:5.13.pli: Tassa jimhaṃ kāyakammaṃ hoti, jimhaṃ vacīkammaṃ, jimhaṃ manokammaṃ, jimhā gati, jimhupapatti.
an10.216:5.13.eng: Doing crooked deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth are crooked.

an10.216:6.1.pli: Jimhagatikassa kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, jimhupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
an10.216:6.1.eng: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is crooked is reborn in one of two places, I say:

an10.216:6.2.pli: ye vā ekantadukkhā nirayā yā vā saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni.
an10.216:6.2.eng: in an exclusively painful hell, or among the species of creepy animals.

an10.216:6.3.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, saṃsappajātikā tiracchānayoni?
an10.216:6.3.eng: And what are the species of creepy animals?

an10.216:6.5.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti,
an10.216:6.5.eng: This is how a being is born from a being.

an10.216:6.6.eng: For your deeds determine your rebirth,

an10.216:6.7.eng: and when you’re reborn contacts strike you.

an10.216:6.8.eng: This is why I say that sentient beings are heirs to their deeds.

an10.216:6.9.pli: Kammassakā, bhikkhave, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammapaṭisaraṇā, yaṃ kammaṃ karonti—
an10.216:6.9.eng: Sentient beings are the owners of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.

an10.216:6.10.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavanti.
an10.216:6.10.eng: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.

an10.216:7.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco pāṇātipātaṃ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho, lajjī dayāpanno sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
an10.216:7.1.eng: Take a certain someone who gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of sympathy for all living beings.

an10.216:7.2.pli: So na saṃsappati kāyena, na saṃsappati vācāya, na saṃsappati manasā.
an10.216:7.2.eng: They’re not creepy in body, speech, and mind.

an10.216:7.3.pli: Tassa uju kāyakammaṃ hoti, uju vacīkammaṃ, uju manokammaṃ, uju gati, ujupapatti.
an10.216:7.3.eng: Doing virtuous deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth is virtuous.

an10.216:8.1.pli: Ujugatikassa kho panāhaṃ, bhikkhave, ujupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
an10.216:8.1.eng: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is virtuous is reborn in one of two places, I say:

an10.216:8.2.pli: ye vā ekantasukhā saggā yāni vā pana tāni uccākulāni khattiyamahāsālakulāni vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakulāni vā gahapatimahāsālakulāni vā aḍḍhāni mahaddhanāni mahābhogāni pahūtajātarūparajatāni pahūtavittūpakaraṇāni pahūtadhanadhaññāni.
an10.216:8.2.eng: in a heaven of perfect happiness, or in an eminent well-to-do family of aristocrats, brahmins, or householders—rich, affluent, and wealthy, with lots of gold and silver, lots of property and assets, and lots of money and grain.

an10.216:8.3.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti.
an10.216:8.3.eng: This is how a being is born from a being.

an10.216:8.4.eng: For your deeds determine your rebirth,

an10.216:8.5.eng: and when you’re reborn contacts strike you.

an10.216:8.6.eng: This is why I say that sentient beings are heirs to their deeds.

an10.216:9.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco adinnādānaṃ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti …pe…
an10.216:9.1.eng: Take someone else who gives up stealing …

an10.216:9.4.pli: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti …

an10.216:9.5.pli: pharusaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti …

an10.216:9.11.pli: ye imañca lokaṃ parañca lokaṃ sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedentī’ti.

an10.216:9.12.pli: So na saṃsappati kāyena, na saṃsappati vācāya, na saṃsappati manasā.
an10.216:9.12.eng: They’re not creepy in body, speech, and mind.

an10.216:9.13.pli: Tassa uju kāyakammaṃ hoti, uju vacīkammaṃ, uju manokammaṃ, uju gati, ujupapatti.
an10.216:9.13.eng: Doing virtuous deeds by way of body, speech, and mind, their destiny and rebirth is virtuous.

an10.216:10.1.pli: Ujugatikassa kho pana ahaṃ, bhikkhave, ujupapattikassa dvinnaṃ gatīnaṃ aññataraṃ gatiṃ vadāmi—
an10.216:10.1.eng: Someone whose destiny and rebirth is virtuous is reborn in one of two places, I say:

an10.216:10.2.pli: ye vā ekantasukhā saggā yāni vā pana tāni uccākulāni khattiyamahāsālakulāni vā brāhmaṇamahāsālakulāni vā gahapatimahāsālakulāni vā aḍḍhāni mahaddhanāni mahābhogāni pahūtajātarūparajatāni pahūtavittūpakaraṇāni pahūtadhanadhaññāni.
an10.216:10.2.eng: in a heaven of perfect happiness, or in an eminent well-to-do family of aristocrats, brahmins, or householders—rich, affluent, and wealthy, with lots of gold and silver, lots of property and assets, and lots of money and grain.

an10.216:10.3.pli: Iti kho, bhikkhave, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti.
an10.216:10.3.eng: This is how a being is born from a being.

an10.216:10.4.eng: For your deeds determine your rebirth,

an10.216:10.5.eng: and when you’re reborn contacts strike you.

an10.216:10.6.eng: This is why I say that sentient beings are heirs to their deeds.

an10.216:11.1.pli: Kammassakā, bhikkhave, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammapaṭisaraṇā, yaṃ kammaṃ karonti—
an10.216:11.1.eng: Sentient beings are the owners of their deeds and heir to their deeds. Deeds are their womb, their relative, and their refuge.

an10.216:11.2.pli: kalyāṇaṃ vā pāpakaṃ vā—tassa dāyādā bhavanti.
an10.216:11.2.eng: They shall be the heir of whatever deeds they do, whether good or bad.

an10.216:11.3.pli: Ayaṃ kho so, bhikkhave, saṃsappanīyapariyāyo dhammapariyāyo”ti.
an10.216:11.3.eng: This is the exposition of the teaching on creepy creatures.”
